Class RealTimeInput

extends Input

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class codeandchords.input.Input

        Input.DisposeHandler

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RealTimeInput(int numInputs, AudioContext audioContext, boolean skip5thru8, PApplet pa)
      Creates an Input object with the given number of inputs and the particular AudioContext, as well as the option to skip inputs 5-8 (this assumes that you will have adjusted for the skip and passed in 4 more inputs than you plan to need; e.g., numInputs = 16 for 12 lines).
      RealTimeInput(int numInputs, AudioContext audioContext, PApplet pa)
      Creates an Input object with the given number of inputs and particular AudioContext.
      RealTimeInput(int numInputs, boolean skip5thru8, PApplet pa)
      Creates an Input object connected to PortAudio, with the given number of inputs, as well as the option to skip inputs 5-8 (this assumes that you will have adjusted for the skip and passed in 4 more inputs than you plan to need; e.g., numInputs = 16 for 12 lines).
      RealTimeInput(int numInputs, PApplet pa)
      Creates an Input object connected to PortAudio, with the given number of inputs.
      RealTimeInput(PApplet pa)
      Constructor for creating a one (or two?)-channel Input object from the machine's default audio input device; does not require Jack.

        Creates an Input object connected to PortAudio, with the given number of inputs.
        Parameters:
        numInputs - an int specifying the number of lines in the AudioFormat.

      • RealTimeInput

        public RealTimeInput(int numInputs,
                     boolean skip5thru8,
                     PApplet pa)
        Creates an Input object connected to PortAudio, with the given number of inputs, as well as the option to skip inputs 5-8 (this assumes that you will have adjusted for the skip and passed in 4 more inputs than you plan to need; e.g., numInputs = 16 for 12 lines).
        Parameters:
        numInputs - an int specifying the number of lines in the AudioFormat.

      • RealTimeInput

        public RealTimeInput(int numInputs,
                     AudioContext audioContext,
                     PApplet pa)
        Creates an Input object with the given number of inputs and particular AudioContext.
        Parameters:
        numInputs - an int specifying the number of lines in the AudioFormat.
        audioContext - an AudioContext whose input lines will be procured as a UGen and used for the analysis calculations.

      • RealTimeInput

        public RealTimeInput(int numInputs,
                     AudioContext audioContext,
                     boolean skip5thru8,
                     PApplet pa)
        Creates an Input object with the given number of inputs and the particular AudioContext, as well as the option to skip inputs 5-8 (this assumes that you will have adjusted for the skip and passed in 4 more inputs than you plan to need; e.g., numInputs = 16 for 12 lines).

        audioContext -

      • getAverageFund

        public float getAverageFund(int[] inputsToAverage)
        Calculates the average frequency of multiple input lines.
        Parameters:
        inputsToAverage - an int[] with the numbers of each of the lines whose frequency is to be averaged.
        Returns:
        float The average pitch of the inputs whose numbers are given in the int[] param.

      • getAverageFund

        public float getAverageFund(int firstInput,
                            int lastInput)
        Calculates the average frequency of multiple consecutive input lines, numbered from "firstInput" to "lastInput".
        Parameters:
        firstInput - the number of the first input whose frequency is to be averaged.
        lastInput - the number of the last input whose frequency is to be averaged.
        Returns:
        float The average pitch of the inputs from "firstInput" to "lastInput".

      • getAverageAmp

        public float getAverageAmp(int[] inputsToAverage)
        Calculates the average frequency of multiple input lines.
        Parameters:
        inputsToAverage - an int[] with the numbers of each of the lines whose amplitude is to be averaged.
        Returns:
        float The average amplitude of the inputs whose numbers are given in the int[] param.

      • getAverageAmp

        public float getAverageAmp(int firstInput,
                           int lastInput)
        Calculates the average amplitude of multiple consecutive input lines, numbered from "firstInput" to "lastInput".
        Parameters:
        firstInput - the number of the first input whose amplitude is to be averaged.
        lastInput - the number of the last input whose amplitude is to be averaged.
        Returns:
        float The average pitch of the inputs from "firstInput" to "lastInput".
